edu.byu.cs.superasteroids.ship_builder

Interface IShipBuildingView

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IView
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ShipBuildingActivity

    public interface IShipBuildingView
extends IView
    An interface used by a ShipBuildingController to control the view.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  IShipBuildingView.PartSelectionView 
      static class  IShipBuildingView.ViewDirection

    • Method Detail

      • animateToView

        void animateToView(IShipBuildingView.PartSelectionView view,
                 IShipBuildingView.ViewDirection animationDirection)
        Instructs the ShipBuildingView to animate to a new part selection screen. This function is generally called as a response to a call to the controller's onSlideView() function.
        Parameters:
        view - The part selection view to animate into view
        animationDirection - The direction to use while animating the new view in. EXAMPLE: If LEFT is chosen, the view will animate in from the right, moving left as it does so.

      • setPartViewImageList

        void setPartViewImageList(IShipBuildingView.PartSelectionView view,
                        java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> partImageIds)
        Sets a part selection views list of image IDs. EXAMPLE: To set the list of image IDs for the Cannon selection view, the parameter view would be PartSelectionView.CANNON and partImageIds would be a list of cannon part image IDs.
        Parameters:
        view - The view to set the images for.
        partImageIds - The list of image IDs to set.

      • startGame

        void startGame()
        Instructs the ShipBuildingView to start the game.

      • setStartGameButton

        void setStartGameButton(boolean enabled)
        Enables or disables the start game button. This function should not be called in the ShipBuildingController's constructor. The start game button is initially disabled. The start game button should be enabled when a complete has been constructed by the user.
        Parameters:
        enabled - TRUE if the button should be enabled, FALSE otherwise

      • setArrow

        void setArrow(IShipBuildingView.PartSelectionView partView,
            IShipBuildingView.ViewDirection arrow,
            boolean visible,
            java.lang.String text)
        Sets the visibility and text of an arrow for a part selection view. To ensure the partView is prepared, make sure to only call this function from the controller's onViewLoaded() function.
        Parameters:
        partView - The part selection view to set the arrow for
        arrow - The arrow to set
        visible - TRUE - The arrow and text are visible, FALSE - The arrow and text are invisible
        text - The text to display alongside the arrow. NULL or an empty string if there is no text to display.
